Description.Name: Deja Vu
Description.Details: You are sitting quietly in a bar adjacent to the local hiring hall on [[TGT_SYSTEM,{TGT_SYSTEM.Name}]] scrolling through the list of available names when a name jumps out at you, "Darkan K’Haos.” Without Darius or any of the other mechwarriors from {COMPANY.CompanyName} around to list the pros and cons, you have to decide here an now whether to approach the legendary Khan of Clan Ghost Bear

Description.Name: Not at this time
Description.Details:
You ponder the possible benefits, as well as any negatives before ultimately deciding you do not need someone who could very well command {COMPANY.CompanyName} better than you as a crew member.

You take a long swig of your drink and continue scrolling through the rest of the names in the database.

Description.Name: Offer spare bunk to Darkan K'Haos
Hire DK
Description.Details:
You down the last of your drink, steeling up the nerve to go and speak to a man that has commanded a thousand times over more people than you would ever dream of and head over towards his table.

You notice the looks of other patrons towards the Khan sitting alone at his table: Anger, Contempt, Intrigue, Awe… the list goes on and on but no one other than you and the bar staff seem willing to approach.
 
As you arrive at the Khan’s table, he smiles, and gestures for you to sit, not even concerned with the reason for you approaching.  Before you can say anything, Khan Darkan K’Haos slides a tankard across to you, “You are curious as to why I am here and not with my clan, quiaff?”

The clan dialect distracts you for a moment, as does the fact that this man seated, can still look you straight in the eyes without inclining his head when you are still standing. You sit down, now forced to look up to meet his gaze, “Um, well, yes. It does come across as odd that you would be in a bar for mechwarriors looking for employment.”

The Khan smiles, “Suffice it to say that I needed a break from my duties as Khan of Clan Ghost Bear.  I still yearn for the cockpit of a mech and the roar of battle around me, so I thought to find a company I could loan myself out to that would scratch that itch. This is such a place and you are here to ask me to join your group, quiaff?”

You nod, “Yes, I would be interested in having you as a member of my company.”

The Khan downs his drink, “Convince me that your company is worthy, Commander…”

“Commander {Comander.FirstName} {Commander.LastName}”, you respond. 

Over the next couple of hours, and many tankards of local ale, you and the Khan discuss the nuances of running a company versus being a Khan of a Clan.  Towards the end of the evening, Khan Darkan K’Haos extends his hand to you, “Commander {Comander.FirstName} {Commander.LastName}, your vision appears aligned with my own.  I will join you and your company. Bargained well and done!”

<color=#f69c24>Hiring fee for Darkan K'Haos has been deducted from your account

Darkan K'Haos is now in your barracks</color>
